column4: hey, anyone can help why don't work my floppy drive under 10.04? the BIOS see it..
do you see it in /dev/?       ls -lah /dev/fd*
yes
but I can't open it or format..
pastebin.com/XnywKS81
that's not the floppy, it should say /dev/fd0 thats a diff device.  i wonder if the floppy disk modules are even included in the kernel
sorry, pastebin.com/xAVWek4Q
try mounting it    mkdir /mnt/floppy       mount /dev/fd0 /mnt/floppy
what would be the type of filesystem?
depends on what you formatted it with
donno..I think it's msdos..sec
most likely it's fat
I tried it with msdos and vfat, but it said, that there are errors in filesystem type, or bad superblock..etc
i'm assuming you can load the floppy in another system and it sees data, yes?  if it's a linux system do a mount and you should be able to see the filesystem type, or do a fdisk -l
after fdisk -l still looking for the FS type..
and by the way I don't have other PC-s with non-Linux OS and floppy drive:)
any pcs?
I can't format iswith fdisk it said always to reboot ("old kernel?"), thanks anyway:)
i was going to suggest using a windows compupter to copy the data off, or make a raw image, and then transferring it to linux via ethernet/usb
yes, but I don't know why don't work..thanks again, bye:)
I format the disk under my father's old worklaptop, then I can mount it with sudo, but the "normal" way still not work
it may have been unformatted?
